block.p: Laing Phillips Foster, a daughter of Laura Burbank Smith and John Hallett Foster, both of New York, was married last evening to John William Rikkers, a son of Margery Jeanne Rikkers and William John Rikkers, both of Minneapolis. The Rev. John Vaughn, an American Baptist minister, officiated at the Riverside Church in New York.

Mrs. Rikkers, 29, is an employee-relations manager at the Amerada Hess Corporation, the oil and gas company in New York. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and is studying for a master's degree in organizational psychology at Columbia University.

Laing Phillips Foster, a daughter of Laura Burbank Smith and John Hallett Foster, both of New York, was married last evening to John William Rikkers, a son of Margery Jeanne Rikkers and William John Rikkers, both of Minneapolis. The Rev. John Vaughn, an American Baptist minister, officiated at the Riverside Church in New York.

Mrs. Rikkers, 29, is an employee-relations manager at the Amerada Hess Corporation, the oil and gas company in New York. She graduated cum laude from Harvard University and is studying for a master's degree in organizational psychology at Columbia University.

The bride's father owns the Foster Management Company, an investment and venture capital business in Valley Forge, Pa. He is also a trustee of the Hospital for Surgery in New York and an overseer at the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth College. Her mother owns Laura Smith Design Associates, an interior design business in New York. The bride's stepfather, James Stuart Smith, is the president of the Arnold Frese Foundation in New York, which supports health and educational institutions. Her stepmother, Lynn Allison Foster, is a senior vice president of Ashbridge Investment Management in Philadelphia.

Mr. Rikkers, 37, is the producer of ''30 by 30: Kid Flicks,'' a series of 30-minute programs made by children, which appears on HBO Family, a Home Box Office cable channel. He works in New York. He graduated cum laude from St. Olaf College in Northfield, Minn. His father retired as the owner of Yale Inc., a heating, ventilation and air-conditioning installation and service company in Minneapolis.
